main event: A ground object, the size of a grounded car, hovered at an altitude of 200 to 300 feet with irregular motion observed on September 23, 1957.
interesting points: The object was observed for 15 minutes during a clear night,It made at least 15-20 directional changes during the observation period,The object was described as brighter than a star,It had both vertical and back-and-forth movement,The case was classified as possibly astronomical due to insufficient data.
sighted object: a round object, possibly a balloon or astronomical body
witness description: Various ranked members of the 778th ACW Squadron, including radar operators.
